content: Where should I check out today?.

Good day Mr. Al Pacino! There are plenty of attractions nearby to explore during your stay at the Residence Inn New York Manhattan/Times Square. You could start your day by visiting the iconic Times Square, which is a short walk from the hotel. You can also check out the Broadway Theatre District and catch one of the spectacular shows.

If you're looking for some green space, Bryant Park is another great option. Empire State Building, St. Patricks Cathedral and Rockefeller Center are also near the hotel.

Other nearby attractions within a reasonable distance include Ellis Island, Statue of Liberty, Museum of Modern Art, Central Park and Grand Central Terminal.

There are certainly plenty of exciting sights and sounds to discover in New York City, so it really depends on what you're in the mood for.
Pick the best one for a date.

Based on the attractions nearby, I would suggest visiting Bryant Park in the late afternoon/evening for a date. The park offers a romantic atmosphere with beautiful greenery and picturesque views. You can stroll through the park and enjoy the tranquility or have a seat on one of the benches. The Bryant Park Lounge, located inside the Residence Inn New York Manhattan/Times Square, is also a great place to grab drinks and dinner entrees with stunning views of the city. A perfect spot for a romantic evening.
I'll do that. What should I wear?

The dress code at the Bryant Park Lounge is casual, so you can wear something comfortable yet stylish for your date. You could opt for a nice pair of jeans and a dress shirt or a casual button-down shirt with leather shoes. A dress or skirt with a blouse would also be a great option for women. The most important thing is to wear something that makes you feel comfortable and confident on your date.
